notifications.body: A great web application needs awesome charts to visualize data in a human readable form, so let’s have a look at how to add some to yours. Let’s first consider the different options we have for creating charts; Vaadin Pro and Prime come with Vaadin Charts, Vaadin Directory has several add-ons for Charts and there are several chart JavaScript libraries on the Internet you could integrate.
notifications.title: Charts with Vaadin

notifications.linkText: Mission RIP Table: Migrate to Grid! - Basic
notifications.body: As promised earlier, here is the first and most basic example. As a reference, Gridv7 is the Grid component from Framework 7, while Grid is the latest Grid component in Framework 8. Naturally, you can also migrate straight from Table to the Framework 8 style Grid.
notifications.title: Mission RIP Table: Migrate to Grid! - Basic

notifications.linkText: Welcome to the Free Vaadin 8 Certification Week!
notifications.body: After the releases of Vaadin 8 and 8.1 we are happy to announce that our certifications have been updated as well. We’d like to celebrate this with you during our upcoming Free Vaadin 8 Certification Week. You’ll get the chance to join our more than 1000 Certified Vaadin developers all over the globe and prove your Vaadin skills with no cost at all. The Free Vaadin 8 Certification Week will take place from September 4th to September 10th 2017.
notifications.title: Welcome to the Free Vaadin 8 Certification Week!

notifications.body:
Both Grails and Vaadin focus on developer productivity, but in different layers of a typical web app stack. Does it make them a perfect match? In this webinar, we will introduce Grails and Vaadin 8 concepts and proceed to show how easy it is to make the two frameworks play nicely together thanks to the power of Spring Boot.

Webinar takes place on Thursday September 14, 2017 @ 2PM CEST
notifications.title: Webinar: Vaadin ? Grails

notifications.body: We’re happy to announce the release of Vaadin Charts 5 with support for Polymer 2! Vaadin Charts offers a range of custom elements for data visualization, from simple column charts to complex combinations of more than one type of chart.
notifications.title: Adding charts to Polymer 2 apps

notifications.linkText: Mission RIP Table: Migrate to Grid! - Intro
notifications.body: Vaadin Grid was announced over two years ago, and since then it has evolved with many new features and enhancements. If this wasn’t enough killer for the Table component, then the announcement of Vaadin Framework 8 earlier this year, with explicit deprecation of Table, places it in a critical state, and it’s now time to upgrade your source code and enjoy the latest features, bug fixes, and all latest updates.
notifications.title: Mission RIP Table: Migrate to Grid! - Intro

notifications.body: Subscribe to the new Vaadin Prime package and get access to all online trainings for your entire team and save thousands during your first year!
notifications.title: Making Prime Better with Training

notifications.body: A key element in any successful open-source project is its community. In the case of Vaadin, the community collaborates mostly by asking and answering questions in forums, reporting issues, suggesting improvements, contributing with patches to the core products or with add-ons published at vaadin.com/directory.
notifications.title: Community Spotlight - July 2017

notifications.body: I’m pleased to announce that Vaadin Framework 8.1 is now declared as stable. As discussed earlier, it brings the much awaited component support to the Grid’s columns, Vaadin 8 style support for hierarchical data structures (Tree and TreeGrid), improved drag and drop support, and enhanced OSGi (& Liferay 7) features.
notifications.title: Vaadin Framework 8.1 is now stable

notifications.body: In March, 2017 Vaadin  introduced Prime, our new subscription plan. Customers are now upgrading their old support contracts and enjoying the benefits of a Prime subscription, including access to Pro Tools, expert chat with Vaadin Experts, and on-demand development support.  How can we make your experience even better?
notifications.title: Making Prime Better with Training

notifications.body: In the previous part of this blog, I talked about the most important steps to get your project to compile with the latest Framework version.
notifications.title: Upgrading to Vaadin Framework 8 (Part 2 of 2)

notifications.linkText: Time to get responsive, Vaadin Board for Java is out!
notifications.body: Today the Vaadin Pro team is happy to introduce Vaadin Board for Java. It is a Vaadin component  for creating flexible responsive layouts very easily. No need to hassle with CSS, you just write plain Java code.
notifications.title: Time to get responsive, Vaadin Board for Java is out!

notifications.linkText: Vaadin Elements end of June update
notifications.body: Last month, in time for the Polymer 2 release, we announced pre-releases of all our Core Elements with Polymer 2 support. We're happy to say that we've now finalized the upgrade work and all Elements ship with Polymer 2 support. The updated elements are now easier to use with any framework as they do not require special syntax for doing things like DOM manipulation.
notifications.title: Vaadin Elements end of June update

notifications.body: The Designer team is pleased to announce the availability of the Designer 2.2 for Framework 8 and Designer 1.4 for Framework 7 for Eclipse and Intellij.
notifications.title: Vaadin Designer 1.4 and 2.2 released

notifications.linkText: Vaadin best practices are now available in a Zip-file
notifications.body: Vaadin best practices are now available for any business grade full stack application, in plain source code! We are happy to announce that we have just released a brand new product for anyone to get started with Vaadin the right way: Bakery App Starter for Vaadin Framework 8 and Spring. You can think of it as an app starter, a kickstarter project, or a project template, but we simply called it a Starter. It is a fully functional and tested full stack application that includes the best practices our experts are using every day. It even has a built-in testing setup for integration and scalability tests. The starter is called Bakery as the application itself is a controlling system for an imaginary bakery coffee shop.
notifications.title: Vaadin best practices are now available in a Zip-file

notifications.body: With a major release, you would usually expect major modifications in the core of the framework. But this time, the migration is not too complicated. Not only because of the migration tool provided to make a smooth transition from Framework 7 to Framework 8, but also because of the similarity in many of the components’ APIs.
notifications.title: Upgrading to Vaadin Framework 8 (Part 1 of 2)

notifications.body:
Want to have a Vaadin presentation at your local event? We've received really good feedback and are happy to join you and your group as well – let's schedule it together!

Contact Vaadin Advocate Ville Ingman at ville@vaadin.com for more info.
notifications.title: Speech at your meetup or company?
